VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A VARIANT that specifies or receives the minimum number of lines to print at the top of a document.

css\/properties\/left.SUMMARY: Sets the left edge of an element

VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage of the width of the parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/mask-position.SUMMARY: A list, each item consisting of: two keywords representing the origin and two offsets from that origin, each given as an absolute length (if given a <length>), otherwise as a percentage.

css\/properties\/flex-flow.SUMMARY: The ‘flex-flow’ property is a shorthand for setting the ‘flex-direction’ and ‘flex-wrap’ properties, which together define the flex container's main and cross axes.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: See individual properties: flex-direction flex-wrap
VALUES.TITLE: <flex-direction> <flex-wrap>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value for the scrollTop property.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value for the scrollTop property is equal to scrollHeight.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 8. Content flows vertically from bottom to top, left to right.
VALUES.TITLE: bt-lr

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 8. Content flows vertically from top to bottom, left to right. The next vertical line is positioned to the right of the previous line.
VALUES.TITLE: tb-lr

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Content flows vertically from bottom to top, right to left. The next vertical line is positioned to the left of the previous line. Wide-cell glyphs are positioned upright; nonwide-cell glyphs (also known as narrow Latin or narrow Kana glyphs) are rotated 90° clockwise. This layout is used for right-to-left script blocks used in vertical East Asian typography.
VALUES.TITLE: bt-rl

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Content flows vertically from top to bottom, right to left. The next vertical line is positioned to the left of the previous line. Wide-cell glyphs are positioned upright; nonwide-cell glyphs (also known as narrow Latin or narrow Kana glyphs) are rotated 90° clockwise. This layout is used in East Asian typography.
VALUES.TITLE: tb-rl

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Content flows horizontally from right to left, top to bottom. The next horizontal line is positioned underneath the previous line. All glyphs are positioned upright. This layout is used with right-to-left scripts like Arabic, Hebrew, Thaana, and Syriac.
VALUES.TITLE: rl-tb

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Content flows horizontally from left to right, top to bottom. The next horizontal line is positioned underneath the previous line. All glyphs are positioned upright. This layout is used by most writing systems.
VALUES.TITLE: lr-tb

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 9. For use on SVG and HTML elements. Equivalent to tb-rl.
VALUES.TITLE: tb

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 9. For use on SVG and HTML elements. Equivalent to rl-tb.
VALUES.TITLE: rl

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 9. For use on SVG and HTML elements. Equivalent to lr-tb.
VALUES.TITLE: lr

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 8. Content flows horizontally from bottom to top, right to left.
VALUES.TITLE: rl-bt

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 8. Content flows horizontally from bottom to top, left to right. The next horizontal line is positioned above the previous line.
VALUES.TITLE: lr-bt

css\/properties\/text-indent.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the indentation of the first line of text in the object.

VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px).
VALUES.TITLE: length

css\/properties\/mask-box-image.SUMMARY: This is a shorthand property for setting ‘mask-box-image-source’, ‘mask-box-image-slice’, ‘mask-box-image-width’, ‘mask-box-image-outset’ and ‘mask-box-image-repeat’. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

css\/properties\/mask.SUMMARY: Masking is a combination of opacity values and clipping. Like clipping you can use shapes, text or paths to define sections of the mask. The default state of a mask is fully transparent which is the opposite of clipping plane. The graphics in a mask sets how opaque portions of the mask are.

css\/properties\/border-left-color.SUMMARY: The CSS border-left-color property sets the color of an element's left border.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A Variant that specifies or receives one of the color names or RGB values in the Color Table.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed along the block axis.

css\/properties\/border-width.SUMMARY: Sets the width of an element's four borders. This property can have from one to four values.

VALUES.TITLE: thick

css\/properties\/font-size-adjust.SUMMARY: This property adjusts the font-size of the fallback fonts defined with font-family, so that the x-height is the same no matter what font is used. This preserves the readability of the text when fallback occurs.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The aspect value used in calculating the size of the fallback fonts.. For the adjusted font size calculation, see Remarks.
VALUES.TITLE: number

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The aspect value is calculated by the user agent for the first font in the font-family list, and used for every font in that list.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only use the font-size value to determine the size of the font.
VALUES.TITLE: none

css\/properties\/column-gap.SUMMARY: The column-gap attribute allows CSS developers to control the distance between columns in a multi-column layout.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
A floating-point number, followed by either an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px), that indicates the width of the gap between columns. For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Length Units Reference.


Negative values are not valid.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The default width is 1em.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

css\/properties\/margin-top.SUMMARY:
Sets the top margin of an element.

Margin-top creates space outside the outer edge of an element (beyond the top border). Margins are transparent.
css\/properties\/margin-top.COMPUTEDVALUE: The percentage as specified or the absolute length.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed width. Negative values are allowed.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage of the width of the containing block. Negative values are allowed. (Even though this is margin-top, the browser will take the percentage from the width, not the height of the containing block.)

css\/properties\/msContentZoomFactor.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that indicates the content zoom factor. This property has no effect on non-zoomable elements. For information on zoomable elements, see -ms-content-zooming.

css\/properties\/float.SUMMARY: Elements which get float applied with a value other than none are taken from the normal flow and get wrapped on the left or right side of the parent element. Other elements get wrapped around it.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The right value indicates that the element must float to the right side of its containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The left value indicates that the element must float to the left side of its containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: none indicates that the element does not contain any float at all. This is the initial value of the float property.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a %. The value is a percentage of the width of the parent object, whether or not it is specified explicitly. Negative values are not allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: width

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Default width of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/caption-side.SUMMARY: Specifies the placement of a table caption.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: For horizontal tables, the caption is placed below the table. Not supported for vertical tables.
VALUES.TITLE: bottom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: For horizontal tables (in horizontal writing modes), the caption is placed above the table. Not supported for vertical tables (in vertical writing modes).
VALUES.TITLE: top

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: For vertical tables, the caption is placed at the right of the table. Not supported for horizontal tables.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: For vertical tables, the caption is placed at the left of the table. Not supported for horizontal tables.
VALUES.TITLE: left

css\/properties\/font-stretch.SUMMARY: Allows you to make text wider or narrower.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that the property takes the same computed value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the most expanded font face.
VALUES.TITLE: ultra-expanded

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates a wider value relative to the width of the parent element.
VALUES.TITLE: wider

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates a narrower value relative to the width of the parent element.
VALUES.TITLE: narrower

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the second most expanded font face.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Indicates the face is neither condensed nor expanded.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates a condensed font face.
VALUES.TITLE: condensed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates a slightly condensed font face.
VALUES.TITLE: semi-condensed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the most condensed font face.
VALUES.TITLE: ultra-condensed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the second most condensed font face.
VALUES.TITLE: extra-condensed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates a slightly expanded font face.
VALUES.TITLE: semi-expanded

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates an expanded font face.
VALUES.TITLE: expanded

css\/properties\/backface-visibility.SUMMARY: This property property determines whether or not the "back" side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The back face of an element is a transparent background, displaying a mirror image of the front face when the back face is observable.
VALUES.TITLE: visible

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: There are cases when we do not want the front face of an element to be visible through the back face, like when doing a flipping card effect (setting two elements side-to-side). In this case, the property should be set to hidden to make the back face of the element opaque.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

css\/properties\/font-feature-settings.SUMMARY: Gets or sets one or more values that specify glyph substitution and positioning in fonts that include OpenType layout features.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Comma-separated list of one or more OpenType layout feature tags (each with an optional toggle). See Remarks for examples of correct syntax, plus a table of the most common feature tags and their definitions.
VALUES.TITLE: feature-tag-value

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

css\/properties\/page-break-before.SUMMARY: The page-break-before property sets the page-breaking behavior before an element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Avoid inserting a page break before the element.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Insert a page break before the element.
VALUES.TITLE: always

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Insert a page break before the element if necessary.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that the value of the page-break-before property should be inherited from the parent element
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Insert page breaks before the element until it reaches a blank right page.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Insert page breaks before the element until it reaches a blank left page.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves the same as auto.
VALUES.TITLE: empty string

css\/properties\/animation-delay.SUMMARY: The animation-delay CSS property specifies when the animation should start. This lets the animation sequence begin some time after it's applied to an element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by a time units designator (ms [milliseconds] or s [seconds]). For more information about the supported time units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: time

css\/properties\/padding-bottom.SUMMARY: The padding-bottom CSS property of an element sets the padding space required below an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and its border. Negative values are not allowed.
css\/properties\/padding-bottom.COMPUTEDVALUE: the percentage as specified or the absolute length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a positive fixed distance. See length for details.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage with respect to the height of the containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/-ms-flex-line-pack.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that specifies how a flexbox's lines align within the flexbox when there is extra space along the axis that is perpendicular to the axis defined by the -ms-flex-direction property.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Lines are evenly distributed in the flexbox, with half-size spaces on either end. If the leftover free space is negative or there is only a single line in the flexbox, this value is identical to [#center center]. Otherwise, the lines in the flexbox are distributed such that the empty space between any two adjacent lines is the same, and the empty space before the first and after the last lines in the flexbox are half the size of the other empty spaces.
VALUES.TITLE: distribute

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space. If the leftover free space is negative, this value is identical to [#start start]. Otherwise, the free space is split equally between all of the lines, increasing their cross size.
VALUES.TITLE: stretch

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: All child elements are placed edge to edge with each other, as described in the descriptions for the [#start start] or [#end end] keywords. However, the group of child elements is centered between the starting and ending edges of the parent element so that all remaining space is evenly distributed before the first child element and after the last child element.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The starting edge of the first child element is placed at the start of the parent element; the ending edge of the last child element is placed edge to edge with the end of the parent box; and all remaining children are placed between the first and last child elements, so that any space that remains along the layout axis is equally distributed between child elements.
VALUES.TITLE: justify

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The starting edge of the first child element is placed at the start of the parent element; the starting edge of the next child element is placed edge to edge with the ending edge of the first child element; and so on along the layout axis direction. All space that remains along the layout axis is placed at the end of the layout axis.
VALUES.TITLE: start

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The ending edge of the first child element is placed at the end of the parent element; the ending edge of the next child element is placed edge to edge with the starting edge of the first child element; and so on along the layout axis direction. All space remaining along the layout axis is placed at the start of the layout axis.
VALUES.TITLE: end

css\/properties\/animation-timing-functi.SUMMARY: Sets the pace of the transition to the next keyframe of an animation

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
A keyword or function that describes how the animation progresses between keyframes.

ease
Default. A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that gradually increases in speed at the start, animates at full speed, and then gradually decreases in speed at the end. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25,0.1,0.25,1). File:msTransition-ease-cubic.png
linear
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that has a consistent speed from start to end. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0,0,1,1). File:msTransition-linear-cubic.png
ease-in
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that gradually increases in speed at the start. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42,0,1,1). File:msTransition-ease-in-cubic.png
ease-out
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that gradually decreases in speed at the end. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0,0,0.58,1). File:msTransition-ease-out-cubic.png
ease-in-out
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that gradually increases in speed at the start and then gradually decreases in speed at the end. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42,0,0.58,1). File:msTransition-ease-in-out-cubic.png
steps(number, position)
The change takes place in the number of equal steps specified in the first argument. The optional second argument should be either the keyword start or end. It specifies whether the change takes place at the start or end of each step. If the second argument is omitted, it defaults to end.
step-start
The change takes place at the start of the keyframe. This is equivalent to steps(1, start).
step-end
The change takes place at the end of the keyframe. This is equivalent to steps(1, end).
cubic-bezier( x1, y1, x2, y2 )
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that takes four parameters. The four values specify the x and y-coordinates as (x1, y1, x2, y2) of the P1 and P2 points of the curve, respectively.

Note For properties other than opacity and color, the cubic-bezier curve function accepts y-coordinates outside the standard range of [0, 1]. This allows the ability to specify "elastic" effects for properties such as length and width, as shown in the following image. File:msTransition-ease-in-out-elastic-cubic.png
VALUES.TITLE: single-animation-timing-function

css\/properties\/-ms-flex-item-align.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that specifies the alignment (perpendicular to the layout axis defined by the -ms-flex-direction property) of child elements of the object.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The baselines (leading edge or trailing edge depending on the -ms-flex-direction property) of all child elements are aligned with each other.

The child element that occupies the most space, perpendicular to the layout axis, follows the start rule; the baselines of all remaining elements are then aligned with the baseline of this element.
VALUES.TITLE: baseline

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. Indicates that the value of the flexbox item's -ms-flex-item-align property is equivalent to that of the parent flexbox element's -ms-flex-align property.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-flex-direction of row or column, the leading edge (or baseline) of each child element is aligned with the leading edge of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is placed after the trailing edge of each child element.

If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-flex-direction of row-reverse or column-reverse, the trailing edge (or baseline) of each child element is aligned with the trailing edge of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is placed before the leading edge of each child element.
VALUES.TITLE: start

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-flex-direction of row or column, the trailing edge of each child element is aligned with the trailing edge of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is placed before the leading edge of each child element.

If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-flex-direction of row-reverse or column-reverse, the leading edge of each child element is aligned with the leading edge of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is placed after the trailing edge of each child element.
VALUES.TITLE: end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each child element is centered between the leading and trailing edges of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is evenly distributed before and after each child.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each child element is stretched to completely fill the space that is available perpendicular to the layout axis. If set, the max-width or max-height property for a child element takes precedence and layout follows the start rule.
VALUES.TITLE: stretch

css\/properties\/border-bottom-color.SUMMARY: Sets the color of the bottom border.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A Variant that specifies or receives one of the color names or RGB values in the Color Table.
VALUES.TITLE: color

css\/properties\/color.SUMMARY: The color property sets the color of an element's foreground content (usually text), accepting any standard CSS color from keywords and hex values to RGB(a) and HSL(a).
css\/properties\/color.INITIALVALUE: black, except in a few cases (see notes)
css\/properties\/color.COMPUTEDVALUE: For a non-translucent color, an hexadecimal equivalent is used. Otherwise it is the RGBa equivalent

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: CSS color value
VALUES.TITLE: color

css\/properties\/font-family.SUMMARY: This property contains a comma-separated list of font family names and/or generic family names. For each character that a user agent (browser) has to render, it iterates through the list of family names (first to last) until it matches a font that contains a glyph for that character.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Generic font families are used as a fallback when none of the previously specified fonts are available. It is always the last alternative in the list of font-family names. The following generic family keywords are defined: serif, sans-serif, cursive, fantasy and monospace.
VALUES.TITLE: generic-family

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The name of a font family, such as Courier or Arial. In CSS 3 you can also reference external fonts defined with @font-face
VALUES.TITLE: family-name

css\/properties\/padding-right.SUMMARY: The padding-right CSS property of an element sets the padding space required on the right side of an element.
css\/properties\/padding-right.COMPUTEDVALUE: the percentage as specified or the absolute length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage with respect to the width of the containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a positive fixed width. See length for details.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer value that identifies the group that a child element belongs to.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

css\/properties\/mask-box-image-outset.SUMMARY:
The values specify the amount by which the mask box image area extends beyond the border box. If it has four values, they set the outsets on the top, right, bottom and left sides in that order. If the left is missing, it is the same as the right; if the bottom is missing, it is the same as the top; if the right is missing, it is the same as the top.

As with ‘mask-box-image-width’, a <number> represents a multiple of the corresponding ‘border-width’. Negative values are not allowed for any of the ‘mask-box-image-outset’ values.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: When normal inertia would leave content near a snap point, inertia is adjusted to land exactly on the snap point. However, it is still possible to land between snap points.
VALUES.TITLE: proximity

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. Panning and scrolling are unaffected by any defined snap-points. Touch flicks will result in normal inertia.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inertia is adjusted to ensure content always lands on a snap point.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Text is centered.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Text is aligned like the other lines in the object, using the value of the text-align property.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Text is justified.
VALUES.TITLE: justify

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Text is aligned like the text in the parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Text is aligned to the left.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Text is aligned to the right.
VALUES.TITLE: right

css\/properties\/mask-source-type.SUMMARY: The ‘mask-source-type’ property indicates whether the <mask-reference> is treated as luminescence mask or alpha mask.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.

  • <start length> specifies where the first snap-point will be placed.
  • <step length> specifies the distance between subsequent snap-points both to the left and the right of the initial snap-point.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Specifies the position of individual snap-points.

  • If the value specified in <start lengths> is less than -ms-scroll-limit-x-min the value of -ms-scroll-limit-x-min is used.
  • If the value specified in <list lengths> is greater that -ms-scroll-limit-x-max, the value of -ms-scroll-limit-x-max is used.
VALUES.TITLE: snapList(<list lengths>)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.

  • <start length> specifies where the first snap-point will be placed.
  • <step length> specifies the distance between subsequent snap-points both to the left and the right of the initial snap-point.
VALUES.TITLE: snapInterval(<start length>, <step length>)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Specifies the position of individual snap-points.

  • If the value specified in <list lengths> is less than -ms-scroll-limit-x-min the value of -ms-scroll-limit-x-min is used.
  • If the value specified in <list lengths> is greater that -ms-scroll-limit-x-max, the value of -ms-scroll-limit-x-max is used.

css\/properties\/border-bottom-left-radi.SUMMARY: Defines the shape of the border of the bottom-left corner.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage of the height of the parent object, which must be specified explicitly. Negative values are not allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: height

css\/properties\/-ms-content-zoom-snap.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-content-zoom-snap-type and the -ms-content-zoom-snap-points properties. This property has no effect on non-zoomable elements. See -ms-content-zooming for details on zoomable elements.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the -ms-content-zoom-snap-points property.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-box-direction of normal, the leading edge (or baseline) of each child element is aligned with the leading edge of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is placed after the trailing edge of each child element.

If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-box-direction of reverse, the trailing edge (or baseline) of each child element is aligned with the trailing edge of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is placed before the leading edge of each child element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The baselines (leading edge or trailing edge depending on the -ms-box-direction property) of all child elements are aligned with each other.

The child element that occupies the most space, perpendicular to the layout axis, follows the before rule; the baselines of all remaining elements are then aligned with the baseline of this element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Each child element is stretched to completely fill the space that is available perpendicular to the layout axis. If set, the max-width or max-height property for a child element takes precedence and layout follows the before rule.
VALUES.TITLE: stretch

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-box-direction of normal, the trailing edge of each child element is aligned with the trailing edge of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is placed before the leading edge of each child element.

If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-box-direction of reverse, the leading edge of each child element is aligned with the leading edge of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is placed after the trailing edge of each child element.
VALUES.TITLE: after

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each child element is centered between the leading and trailing edges of the object. Any remaining space, perpendicular to the layout axis, is evenly distributed before and after each child.
VALUES.TITLE: middle

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Default. Child elements are displayed in the same order that they are declared in the source document.

If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-box-orient of horizontal, the child elements are displayed from left to right.

If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-box-orient of vertical, the child elements are displayed from top to bottom.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed in the same order as the computed value of this property for the parent element.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Child elements are displayed in the reverse order that they are declared in the source document.

If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-box-orient of horizontal, the child elements are displayed from right to left.

If the parent element has a computed value for -ms-box-orient of vertical, the child elements are displayed from bottom to top.
VALUES.TITLE: reverse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object is placed at the bottom of the row.
VALUES.TITLE: end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The object is placed at the top of the row.
VALUES.TITLE: start

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object is stretched to completely fill the height that is available in the row.
VALUES.TITLE: stretch

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object is centered within the row.
VALUES.TITLE: center

css\/properties\/white-space.SUMMARY: The white-space property controls if a white-space character within an element can wrap or if it must be preserved.

VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Line breaks are suppressed. Content does not wrap to the next line.
VALUES.TITLE: nowrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Line breaks and other whitespace are preserved. This possible value is supported starting in Internet Explorer 6 when the !DOCTYPE declaration specifies standards-compliant mode. When the !DOCTYPE declaration does not specify standards-compliant mode, you can retrieve this value, but it does not affect rendering—it functions like the normal value.
VALUES.TITLE: pre

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Sequences of line breaks are preserved.
VALUES.TITLE: pre-line

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Sequences of line breaks are collapsed.
VALUES.TITLE: pre-wrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. IME is not affected. This is the same as not specifying the -ms-ime-mode attribute.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: All characters are entered through the IME. Users can still deactivate the IME.
VALUES.TITLE: active

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: All characters are entered without IME. Users can still activate the IME.
VALUES.TITLE: inactive

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: IME is completely disabled. Users cannot activate the IME if the control has focus.

css\/properties\/border-left-style.SUMMARY: The border-left-style property sets the style of an element's left border.

css\/properties\/margin-right.SUMMARY:
Sets the right margin of an element.

Margin-right creates space outside the outer edge of an element (beyond the right border). Margins are transparent.
css\/properties\/margin-right.COMPUTEDVALUE: The percentage as specified or the absolute length.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed width. Negative values are allowed.

css\/properties\/overflow.SUMMARY: The overflow property controls how extra text exceeding the bounding box of an element is rendered. The overflow property can be used in conjunction with an element that has a fixed width and height, to eliminate text-induced page distortion.

css\/properties\/-ms-content-zoom-chaini.SUMMARY: Non standard. Gets or sets a value that indicates the zoom behavior that occurs when a user hits the zoom limit during a manipulation. This property has no effect on non-zoomable elements. For information on zoomable elements, see -ms-content-zooming.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The nearest zoomable parent element begins zooming when the user hits a zoom limit during a manipulation. No bounce effect is shown.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the -ms-scroll-snap-type property.

css\/properties\/margin-bottom.SUMMARY:
Sets the bottom margin of an element.

Margin-bottom creates space outside the outer edge of an element (beyond the bottom border). Margins are transparent.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inherits the parent element's specified margin-bottom width.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage of the width of the containing block. Negative values are allowed. (Even though this is margin-bottom, the browser will take the percentage from the width, not the height of the containing block.)

css\/properties\/page-break-after.SUMMARY: The page-break-after property is supported in all major browsers.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Insert a page break after the element if necessary

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Insert a page break after the element
VALUES.TITLE: always

VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.TITLE: avoid

VALUES.TITLE: left

css\/properties\/mask-box-image-slice.SUMMARY:
This property specifies inward offsets from the top, right, bottom, and left edges of the mask image, dividing it into nine regions: four corners, four edges and a middle. The middle image part is discarded (treated as fully transparent black) unless the ‘fill’ keyword is present.

When four values are specified, they set the offsets on the top, right, bottom and left sides in that order. If the left is missing, it is the same as the right; if the bottom is missing, it is the same as the top; if the right is missing, it is the same as the top.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: all <length>s made absolute, otherwise as specified
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Numbers represent multiples of the corresponding computed ‘border-width’.
VALUES.TITLE: number

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Percentages refer to the size of the mask box image area: the width of the area for horizontal offsets, the height for vertical offsets.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The ‘fill’ keyword, if present, causes the middle part of the mask image to be preserved. (By default it is discarded, i.e., treated as transparent black.)
VALUES.TITLE: fill

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If ‘auto’ is specified then the mask box image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice (see ‘mask-box-image-slice’). If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding ‘border-width’ is used instead.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/mask-size.SUMMARY: Specifies the size of the mask images.

css\/properties\/text-decoration.SUMMARY:
The text-decoration CSS property is used to set the text formatting to underline, overline, line-through or blink.
underline and overline decorations are positioned under the text, line-through over it.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Produces no text decoration.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each line of text is underlined.
VALUES.TITLE: underline

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each line of text has a line through the middle.
VALUES.TITLE: line-through

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each line of text has a line above it.
VALUES.TITLE: overline

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Text blinks.
VALUES.TITLE: blink

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The name of the region container.
VALUES.TITLE: identifier

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. No container has been specified.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value for the scrollLeft property is equal to scrollWidth.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value for the scrollLeft property.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object is stretched to completely fill the width that is available in the column.
VALUES.TITLE: stretch

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object is centered within the column.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object is right justified in a left-to-right layout or left justified in a right-to-left layout.
VALUES.TITLE: end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The object is left justified in a left-to-right layout or right justified in a right-to-left layout.
VALUES.TITLE: start

css\/properties\/background.SUMMARY: The ‘background’ property is a shorthand property for setting most background properties at the same place in the style sheet.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The background property is a shorthand property for setting the color, position, size, repeat, clip, origin, attachment, and/or image of the element.

  • color - Any of the values available to background-color property. The default value is transparent.
  • position - Any of the values available to background-position property. The default value is 0% 0%.
  • size - Any of the values available to background-size property. The default value is auto.
  • repeat - Any of the values available to background-repeat property. The default value is repeat.
  • clip - Any of the values available to background-clip property. The default value is border-box.
  • origin - Any of the values available to background-origin property. The default value is padding-box.
  • attachment - Any of the values available to background-attachment property. The default value is scroll.
  • image - Any of the values available to background-image property. The default value is none.
VALUES.TITLE: <background-color> <background-position> <background-size> <background-repeat> <background-clip> <background-origin> <background-attachment> <background-image>

css\/properties\/margin.SUMMARY:
Sets the margin for all four sides of an element.

The margin property is a shorthand to avoid setting each side separately with the other margin properties: margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom and margin-left. Negative values are also allowed.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
1-4 values using length, percentage, or the keywords auto or inherit

  • If one value is given, it applies to all four sides.
  • If two values are given, the first applies to the top and bottom, the second applies to the right and left.
  • If three values are given, the first applies to the top, the second applies to the right and left sides, and the third applies to the bottom.
  • If four values are given, they are applied in clockwise order, starting from the top (top, right, bottom, left).
VALUES.TITLE: <margin-width>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed width. Negative Values are allowed. See length for possible units.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A <percentage> relative to the width of the containing block. Negative values are allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: auto is replaced by some suitable value by the browser. For example, it can be used for centering of blocks. div { width:50%; margin:0 auto; } centers the div container horizontally.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Takes the same specified value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/border-top-left-radius.SUMMARY: Defines the shape of the border of the top-left corner.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Denotes the size of the circle radius or the semi-major and semi-minor axes of the ellipsis. It can be expressed in any unit allowed by the CSS <length> data types. Negative values are invalid.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Denotes the size of the circle radius, or the semi-major and semi-minor axes of the ellipsis, using percentage values. Percentages for the horizontal axis refer to the width of the box, percentages for the vertical axis refer to the height of the box. Negative values are invalid.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/flow-into.SUMMARY: Diverts the selected element's content into a named flow, used to thread content through different layout regions specified by flow-from.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a named flow into which to place element's content.

css\/properties\/animation-duration.SUMMARY: Specifies how long an animation takes to complete one cycle

VALUES.TITLE: time

css\/properties\/mask-origin.SUMMARY: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the mask positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes ‘box-decoration-break’ operates on to determine the mask positioning area(s).

css\/properties\/-ms-flex-order.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that specifies the ordinal group that a flexbox element belongs to. This ordinal value identifies the display order for the group.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer value that identifies the group that a child element belongs to.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

css\/properties\/page-break-inside.SUMMARY: Sets the page-breaking behavior inside an element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves the same as auto.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inherit the value of the same property for the object's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Neither force nor forbid a page break inside the object.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Forbid a page break inside the object, if possible.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid

css\/properties\/text-justify.SUMMARY:
offers a fine level of justification control over the enclosed content, allowing for a variety of sophisticated justification models used in different language writing systems.

Applies to both block and inline elements.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Allows the browser to determine which justification algorithm to apply.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Handles spacing much like the newspaper value. This form of justification is optimized for documents in Asian languages, such as Thai.
VALUES.TITLE: distribute

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Justifies lines of text by elongating characters at chosen points. This form of justification is intended for Arabic script languages. Supported starting in Internet Explorer 5.5.
VALUES.TITLE: kashida

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Aligns text by increasing the space between words. This value's spacing behavior is the fastest way to make all lines of text equal in length. Its justification behavior does not affect the last line of the paragraph.
VALUES.TITLE: inter-word

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Increases or decreases the spacing between letters and between words. It is the most sophisticated form of justification for Latin alphabets.
VALUES.TITLE: newspaper

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Not implemented.
VALUES.TITLE: distribute-center-last

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Justifies lines of text in the same way as the distribute value, except that it also justifies the last line of the paragraph. This form of justification is intended for ideographic text.
VALUES.TITLE: distribute-all-lines

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Justifies lines of ideographic text, and increases or decreases both inter-ideograph and inter-word spacing.
VALUES.TITLE: inter-ideograph

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Justifies lines of text that contain no inter-word spacing. This form of justification is optimized for documents in Asian languages.
VALUES.TITLE: inter-cluster

css\/properties\/-ms-content-zoom-limit.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-content-zoom-limit-min and the -ms-content-zoom-limit-max properties. This property has no effect on non-zoomable elements. See -ms-content-zooming for details on zoomable elements.

VALUES.TITLE: show

css\/properties\/animation-fill-mode.SUMMARY: Controls the state of animated properties before and after an animation

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
One of the following values: none (default), forwards, backwards, both

none
Property values do not change before the animation starts, and they return to their original state when the animation ends.
forwards
When the animation ends, properties retain the values set by the final keyframe.
backwards
If the animation is delayed by animation-delay, properties assume values set by the first keyframe while waiting for the animation to start. When the animation ends, properties revert to their original state.
both
Values set by the first and last keyframes are applied before and after the animation.
The animation-fill-mode property can be specified on its own, or as a property of the animation element. (See http://docs.webplatform.org/wiki/css/properties/animation/animation )
VALUES.TITLE: single-animation-fill-mode

css\/properties\/column-rule-style.SUMMARY: Specifies the style of the rule between columns.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any combination of built-in filter functions: blur(), brightness(), contrast(), custom(), drop-shadow(), grayscale(), hue-rotate(), invert(), opacity(), saturate(), and sepia()

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A reference to an SVG <filter> element

css\/properties\/-ms-content-zoom-limit-.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum zoom factor. VALUES.TITLE: chained

css\/properties\/background-image.SUMMARY: The background-image property allows you to apply one or more background images to an element. These can be url() paths to image files, or CSS3 linear or radial gradients. For more information, consult Using CSS background images and Creating gradients in CSS.
css\/properties\/background-image.COMPUTEDVALUE: As specified, but with URIs made absolute

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This value contains a path to an image that you want to apply to the element in question as a background image, using the CSS images syntax, as described at CSS images: url().
VALUES.TITLE: url(path/to/image.png)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Color of the next parent through which the background is visible.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Programmatically creates a gradient that radiates outwards from a specified point on the element's background. For more on the syntax, read Creating gradients in CSS.
VALUES.TITLE: radial-gradient(50% 50%, circle, #f00, #aaa)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Programmatically creates a gradient that travels from one side of the element to the other. For more on the syntax, read Creating gradients in CSS.
VALUES.TITLE: linear-gradient(to bottom, #f00, #aaa)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: You can apply multiple background images to a single element (image files, gradients, or a mixture) by including all the image references in the property value, with each one separated by a comma. Images referenced earlier in the property value appear in front of images referenced later.
VALUES.TITLE: url(path/to/image.png), url(path/to/image2.png), url(path/to/image3.png)

css\/properties\/mask-box-image-width.SUMMARY:
The mask image is drawn inside an area called the mask box image area. This is an area whose boundaries by default correspond to the mask box, see ‘mask-box-image-outset’.

The four values of ‘mask-box-image-width’ specify offsets that are used to divide the mask box image area into nine parts. They represent inward distances from the the top, right, bottom, and left sides of the area, respectively. If the left width is missing, it is the same as the right; if the bottom is missing, it is the same as the top; if the right is missing, it is the same as the top.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If ‘auto’ is specified then the mask box image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice (see ‘mask-box-image-slice’). If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding ‘border-width’ is used instead.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Numbers represent multiples of the corresponding computed ‘border-width’.
VALUES.TITLE: number

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Percentages refer to the size of the mask box image area: the width of the area for horizontal offsets, the height for vertical offsets.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/border-image-outset.SUMMARY: The border-image-outset property describes, by which amount the border image area extends beyond the border box.
css\/properties\/border-image-outset.COMPUTEDVALUE: all length made absolute, otherwise as specified

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a keyword indicating that all four values are inherited from their parent's element calculated value.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a length or a percentage of the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box past its right edge.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a length or a percentage of the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box past its left edge.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a length or a percentage of the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box past its top edge.
VALUES.TITLE: top

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a length or a percentage of the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box past its bottom edge.
VALUES.TITLE: bottom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a length or a percentage of the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box in both horizontal directions, left and right.
VALUES.TITLE: horizontal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a length or a percentage of the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box in both vertical directions, top and bottom.
VALUES.TITLE: vertical

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a length or a percentage of the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box in all four directions.
VALUES.TITLE: slice

css\/properties\/border-right.SUMMARY: Shorthand property that sets the properties of an element's right border.It can be used to set one or more values (of those: border-right-width, border-right-style, border-right-color).

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The border-right property is a shorthand property for setting the same width, color, and style for only one border of a box: right.

  • Width - Any of the range of width values available to the border-right-width property. It's optional. Default value is medium.
  • Style - Any of the range of style values available to the border-right-style property. Default value is none.
  • Color - Any of the range of color values available to the border-right-color property. Default value is the value of the element's color property - i.e. text color.
VALUES.TITLE: <border-width> <border-style> <color>

css\/properties\/-ms-flex-wrap.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether and in which direction child elements wrap onto multiple lines or columns based on the space available in the object.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are wrapped and displayed in successive, parallel rows or columns in reverse order. The object expands in height or width, perpendicular to the axis defined by the writing-mode property, to accommodate the additional rows or columns.
VALUES.TITLE: wrap-reverse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. All child elements are displayed in a single row or column. The overflow property of the object determines whether the child elements are hidden, clipped, or scrollable.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are wrapped and displayed in successive, parallel rows or columns. The object expands in height or width, perpendicular to the axis defined by the writing-mode property, to accommodate the additional rows or columns.
VALUES.TITLE: wrap

css\/properties\/perspective-origin.SUMMARY: defines where a 3D element is based in the x- and the y-axis.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Second value only. Equal to 100% or the full box height.
VALUES.TITLE: bottom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Second value only. Equal to 50% or a half the height of the box.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Second value only. Equal to 0% or a zero height.
VALUES.TITLE: top

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: First value only. Equal to 100% or the full box length.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: First value only. Equal to 50% or half the length of the box.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: First value only. Equal to 0% or a zero length.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: An integer, followed by a %. The value is a percentage of the total box length (for the first value) or the total box height (for the second value, if specified).
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by either an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px), that indicates the origin of transformation. For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is centered if it is not adjacent to a line edge. If it is adjacent to a line edge, the side of the ruby text lines up with the side of the base text.
VALUES.TITLE: line-edge

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is evenly distributed across the width of the base if the width of the ruby text is smaller than the width of the base. If the width of the ruby text is at least the width of the base, the ruby text is center-aligned.
VALUES.TITLE: distribute-letter

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is evenly distributed across the width of the base if the width of the ruby text is smaller than the width of the base. White space precedes the first and follows the last character in the ruby text, equal to half the kerning of the ruby text. If the width of the ruby text is at least the width of the base, the ruby text is centered.
VALUES.TITLE: distribute-space

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is centered within the width of the base. If the length of the base is smaller than the length of the ruby text, the base is centered within the width of the ruby text.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is right-aligned with the base.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Browser determines how the ruby text is aligned. The recommended behavior for an ideographic (Asian character) ruby is to be aligned in the distribute-space mode. The recommended behavior for a Latin character ruby is to be aligned in the center mode.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is left-aligned with the base.
VALUES.TITLE: left

css\/properties\/min-height.SUMMARY: Sets the minimum height for an element. It prevents the height of the element to exceed the specified value. It overrides both the height & the max-height property if any them is specified below the min-height value.
css\/properties\/min-height.COMPUTEDVALUE: The percentage as specified or the absolute length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If the total available space is finite, equals to min(max-content, max(min-content, fill-available)). Otherwise, equal to the max-content measure. Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: fit-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: See css calc function for mode details.
VALUES.TITLE: calc()

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A <percentage> relative to the height of the containing block. If the containing block has no height explicitly set then is is treated as 0. Negative values are not allowed
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed height. Negative values are not allowed. See length for possible units.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Behaves as 0 for non-flexbox elements. On flexbox acts as min-content.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Fill the entire available space of from the containing block (Height minus horizontal margin, border and padding of the containing block). Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: fill-available

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The narrowest measure a box could take that doesn't lead to inline-dimension overflow that could be avoided by choosing a larger measure. Roughly, the measure that would fit around its contents if all soft wrap opportunities within the box were taken. Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: min-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The narrowest space a box could take while fitting around its contents if none of the soft wrap opportunities within the box were taken.(Space/Punctuation in text are examples of a soft-wrap opportunity). Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: max-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Takes the same specified value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/counter-reset.SUMMARY: Creates or resets one or more counters.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The initial value of the counter. The default value is 0.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The name of the counter, optionally followed by an integer.
VALUES.TITLE: identifier

css\/properties\/border-top-style.SUMMARY: Sets the style of an element's top border.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 6 and later. Same as inset with a thin outside border.
VALUES.TITLE: window-inset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Border is not drawn, regardless of any border-width.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Border is a dotted line.

This value is supported on the Macintosh platform, as of Internet Explorer 4.01, and on the Windows platform, as of Internet Explorer 5.5. It renders as a solid line on UNIX platforms, and on Windows systems running earlier versions of Internet Explorer.
VALUES.TITLE: dotted

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 8. Same as none, except in terms of conflict resolution of collapsed borders. Any element with a hidden border suppresses all shared borders at that location. Borders with a style of none have the lowest priority.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Border is a dashed line.

This value is supported on the Macintosh platform as of Internet Explorer 4.01 and on the Windows platform, as of Internet Explorer 5.5. It renders as a solid line on UNIX platforms, and on Windows systems running earlier versions of Internet Explorer.
VALUES.TITLE: dashed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a solid line.
VALUES.TITLE: solid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a double line drawn on top of the background of the object. The sum of the two single lines and the space between equals the border-width value. The border width must be at least 3 pixels wide to draw a double border.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D groove is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: groove

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D ridge is drawn in colors based on the value.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D inset is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: inset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D outset is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: outset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only a line grid is used. This is recommended for use with inline elements, such as a span, to disable the horizontal grid on runs of text that act as a single entity in the grid layout.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No grid is used.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Both the char and line grid modes are enabled. This setting is necessary to fully enable the layout grid on an element.
VALUES.TITLE: both

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only a character grid is used. This is recommended for use with block-level elements, such as a blockquote, where the line grid is intended to be disabled.
VALUES.TITLE: char

css\/properties\/letter-spacing.SUMMARY: Specifies the spacing behavior between text characters.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Takes the same specified value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The spacing is the normal spacing for the current font.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates inter-character space in addition to the default space between characters. Vakues may be negative, but there may be implementation-specific limits.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. The height of a row is computed based on the tallest child element in that column. This keyword is equivalent to minmax(min-content, max-content).
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The height of each row specified as one of the following values:

  • A length consisting of an integer number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px).
  • A percentage of the object height.
  • A weighted proportion of the object height consisting of an integer number, followed by a fractional designator (fr). For example, if 1fr 2fr is specified, the first row is allocated 1/3 of the object height and the second column is allocated 2/3 of the object height.
VALUES.TITLE: height

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The minimum height of any child elements is used as the height of the row.
VALUES.TITLE: min-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum height of any child elements is used as the height of the row.
VALUES.TITLE: max-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The height of the row is between min and max, as available space allows. The min and max parameters can be any other value of the -ms-grid-rows property, except for auto.
VALUES.TITLE: minmax(min, max)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object has no rows.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by either an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px), that indicates the optimal width. For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Length Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The optimal column width is determined through other property values of the multi-column element, such as columnCount.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. Value is inherited from the element's parent element.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertical to horizontal translation, as described in Remarks, will take place when appropriate.
VALUES.TITLE: vertical-to-horizontal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No scroll wheel translation takes place.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. All child elements are displayed in a single row or column. The overflow property of the object determines whether the child elements are hidden, clipped, or scrollable.
VALUES.TITLE: single

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are wrapped and displayed in successive, parallel rows or columns. The object expands in height or width, perpendicular to the axis defined by the -ms-box-orient property, to accommodate the additional rows or columns.
VALUES.TITLE: multiple

css\/properties\/border-right-style.SUMMARY: Sets the style of an element's right border.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D outset is drawn in colors based on the value.

VALUES.TITLE: inset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D ridge is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: ridge

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D groove is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: groove

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a double line drawn on top of the background of the object. The sum of the two single lines and the space between equals the border-width value. The border width must be at least 3 pixels wide to draw a double border.
VALUES.TITLE: double

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a solid line.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 6 and later. Same as inset with a thin outside border.
VALUES.TITLE: window-inset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 8. Same as none, except in terms of conflict resolution of collapsed borders. Any element with a hidden border suppresses all shared borders at that location. Borders with a style of none have the lowest priority.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Border is not drawn, regardless of any border-width.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Border is a dotted line.

This value is supported on the Macintosh platform, as of Internet Explorer 4.01, and on the Windows platform, as of Internet Explorer 5.5. It renders as a solid line on UNIX platforms, and on Windows systems running earlier versions of Internet Explorer.
VALUES.TITLE: dotted

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Border is a dashed line.

This value is supported on the Macintosh platform as of Internet Explorer 4.01 and on the Windows platform, as of Internet Explorer 5.5. It renders as a solid line on UNIX platforms, and on Windows systems running earlier versions of Internet Explorer.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The textDecoration property is not set to "blink."
The textDecoration property is set to "blink."

css\/properties\/background-size.SUMMARY: Specifies the size of the background images.
css\/properties\/background-size.COMPUTEDVALUE: for <length> the absolute value, otherwise a percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.
VALUES.TITLE: cover

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. See Remarks.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see the CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.
VALUES.TITLE: contain

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: An integer, followed by a percent (%). A percentage value is relative to the background positioning area.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/flex-wrap.SUMMARY: The ‘flex-wrap’ property controls whether the flex container is single-line or multi-line, and the direction of the cross-axis, which determines the direction new lines are stacked in.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex container is single-line. The cross-start direction is equivalent to either the start or before/head direction of the current writing mode, whichever is in the cross axis, and the cross-end direction is the opposite direction of cross-start.
VALUES.TITLE: nowrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex container is multi-line. The cross-start direction is equivalent to either the start or before/head direction of the current writing mode, whichever is in the cross axis, and the cross-end direction is the opposite direction of cross-start.
VALUES.TITLE: wrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Same as ‘wrap’, except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.
VALUES.TITLE: wrap-reverse

css\/properties\/-ms-touch-action.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether and how a given region can be manipulated by the user—for instance, by panning or zooming.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element permits double-tap-zooming. The double-tap-zoom is performed on the full page. Double-tap-zoom is not available in Metro style apps using JavaScript.
VALUES.TITLE: double-tap-zoom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element permits pinch-zooming. The pinch-zoom is performed on the nearest ancestor with zoomable content. For more information on specifying content as zoomable, see the -ms-content-zooming property.
VALUES.TITLE: pinch-zoom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element permits touch-driven panning and pinch-zooming. This is the shorthand equivalent of "pan-x pan-y pinch-zoom".
VALUES.TITLE: manipulation

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element permits no default touch behaviors.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. Indicates the browser will determine the permitted touch behaviors for the element.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element permits touch-driven panning on the vertical axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.
VALUES.TITLE: pan-y

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element permits touch-driven panning on the horizontal axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.
VALUES.TITLE: pan-x

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage derived from the dimensions of the parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. No character grid is set.
VALUES.TITLE: none

css\/properties\/-ms-content-zooming.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether zooming is enabled. This property has no effect unless overflow is permitted on both the x- and y-axes.
css\/properties\/-ms-content-zooming.INITIALVALUE: zoom for the top level element, none for all other elements

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. The element is not zoomable.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element is zoomable.
VALUES.TITLE: zoom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer value that identifies the specified row.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. The width of a column is computed based on the widest child element in that column. This keyword is equivalent to minmax(min-content, max-content).
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum width of any child elements is used as the width of the column.
VALUES.TITLE: max-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The width of the row is between min and max, as available space allows. The min and max parameters can be any other value of the -ms-grid-columns property, except for auto.
VALUES.TITLE: minmax(min, max)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object has no columns.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The width of each column specified as one of the following values:

  • A length consisting of an integer number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px).
  • A percentage of the object width.
  • A weighted proportion of the object width consisting of an integer number, followed by a fractional designator (fr). For example, if 1fr 2fr is specified, the first column is allocated 1/3 of the object width and the second column is allocated 2/3 of the object width.
VALUES.TITLE: width

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width of any child elements is used as the width of the column.
VALUES.TITLE: min-content

css\/properties\/box-shadow.SUMMARY: The ‘box-shadow’ property attaches one or more shadows inside or outside of a box-model element. The property is a comma-separated list of shadows, each specified by 2-4 length values, an optional color, and an optional ‘inset’ keyword. box-shadow is a simple style that can be manipulated to generate complex effects.
css\/properties\/box-shadow.COMPUTEDVALUE: any length made absolute; any specified color computed; otherwise as specified

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The first length is the horizontal offset of the shadow. <offset-x> specifies the horizontal distance. Negative values place the shadow to the left of the element. If both <offset-x> and <offset-y> values are 0, the shadow is placed behind the element (and may generate a blur effect if <blur-radius> and/or <spread-radius> is set).
VALUES.TITLE: <offset-x>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If not specified (default), the shadow is assumed to be a drop shadow (as if the box were raised above the content). The presence of the inset keyword changes the shadow to one inside the frame (as if the content was depressed inside the box). Inset shadows are drawn inside the border (even transparent ones), above the background, but below content.
VALUES.TITLE: <inset>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The third length is a blur radius. The larger this value, the bigger the blur, so the shadow becomes bigger and lighter. Negative values are not allowed. If not specified, it is 0 (the shadow's edge is sharp).
VALUES.TITLE: <blur-radius>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The second length is the vertical offset of the shadow. <offset-y> specifies the vertical distance. Negative values place the shadow above the element. If both <offset-x> and <offset-y> values are 0, the shadow is placed behind the element (and may generate a blur effect if <blur-radius> and/or <spread-radius> is set).
VALUES.TITLE: <offset-y>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: See color values for possible keywords and notations. If not specified, the color used depends on the browser - it is usually the value of the color property, but note that Safari currently paints a transparent shadow in this case.
VALUES.TITLE: <color>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The fourth length is a spread distance. Positive values cause the shadow to expand and grow bigger, negative values cause the shadow to shrink. If not specified, it is 0 (the shadow is the same size as the element). (A zero-sized shadow shape causes the outer shadow to disappear, and the inner shadow to cover the entire padding-box.) For inner shadows, expanding the shadow (creating more shadow area) means contracting the shadow's perimeter shape.
VALUES.TITLE: <spread-distance>

css\/properties\/border-spacing.SUMMARY: Sets the distance between the borders of adjacent cells.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by either an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

css\/properties\/-ms-flex-direction.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that specifies the display order of all child elements of the object.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. Child elements are displayed in the same order that they are declared in the source document, from left to right.
VALUES.TITLE: row

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed in the same order as the computed value of this property for the parent element.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed in the reverse order that they are declared in the source document, from bottom to top.
VALUES.TITLE: column-reverse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed in the reverse order that they are declared in the source document, from right to left.
VALUES.TITLE: row-reverse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed in the same order that they are declared in the source document, from top to bottom.

css\/properties\/column-rule-width.SUMMARY: Specifies the width of the rule between columns.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A line is drawn over the text.

css\/properties\/border-right-color.SUMMARY: Sets the color of an element's right border.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A Variant that specifies or receives one of the color names or RGB values in the Color Table.
VALUES.TITLE: color

css\/properties\/visibility.SUMMARY: Controls the visibility of an element. The hidden value hides an element but leaves space where it would have been.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Object is hidden. The box is invisible (fully transparent, nothing is drawn), but still affects layout. Descendants of the element will be visible if they have visibility:visible (this doesn't work in IE up to version 7).
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 8. Used in tables to remove tr and col; for all other elements, same as hidden.
VALUES.TITLE: collapse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Object inherits the visibility of the next parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Object is visible.
VALUES.TITLE: visible

css\/properties\/text-transform.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the rendering of the text in the object.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Transforms the first character of each word to uppercase.
