Named positions are converted to the equivalent percentage values. Percentage values are based on the relevant axis of the element's bounding box.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by a unit of measurement. Units of measurement may be absolute (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or relative (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A named position along the specified axis, each of which has a percentage equivalent. The values left, center, and right are valid for the x-axis and are equivalent to 0%, 50%, and 100% respectively. The values top, center, and bottom are valid for the y-axis and are equivalent to 0%, 50%, and 100% respectively. There are no named positions along the z-axis.
VALUES.TITLE: named-position

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A number, followed by a %. The value is a percentage of the bounding box width (for the x-axis) or the bounding box height (for the y-axis, if specified). A percentage cannot be applied to the z-axis.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/object-fit.SUMMARY: The object-fit property defines how content of a replaced element (e.g. a video or an image) is made to fit the dimensions of its containing box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The replaced content is sized to to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element's content box
VALUES.TITLE: contain

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box
VALUES.TITLE: cover

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The replaced content is sized to fill the element's box
VALUES.TITLE: fill

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Size the content as if ‘none’ or ‘contain’ were specified, whichever would result in a smaller concrete object size
VALUES.TITLE: scale-down

css\/properties\/cursor.SUMMARY: The cursor CSS property specifies the mouse cursor displayed when the mouse pointer is over an element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Optional. A url(…) or a comma separated list url(…), url(…), … , pointing to an image file. More than one <uri> may be provided as fallback, in case some cursor image types are not supported. A non-URL fallback (one ore more of the other values) must be at the end of the fallback list. See Using URL values for the cursor property for more details.

The <x>, <y> values are optional and experimental. Two unit-less numbers.
VALUES.TITLE: url [x, y]

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
There are many standard cursors available. Available standard cursors: auto, default, none, context-menu, help, pointer, progress, wait, cell, crosshair, text, vertical-text, alias, copy, move, no-drop, not-allowed, e-resize, n-resize, ne-resize, nw-resize, s-resize, se-resize, sw-resize, w-resize, ew-resize, ns-resize, nesw-resize, nwse-resize, col-resize, row-resize, all-scroll, zoom-in, zoom-out

Check out the Examples.
VALUES.TITLE: standard values

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: An integer that indicates by how much the counter is incremented for every occurrence of the element. Zero and negative integers are allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The name of the counter, optionally followed by an increment.
VALUES.TITLE: identifier

css\/properties\/box-sizing.SUMMARY: The box-sizing property alters the CSS box model used to calculate widths and heights of elements.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The width and height (including the min and max properties) of an element are calculated including padding. The dimension properties for the content are calculated by subtracting the padding widths from each side of the element. Dimension properties are set to 0 if the calculated value is less than 0. The border and margin values are not included in the calculation.
VALUES.TITLE: padding-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The width and height values are calculated including the padding and border properties, but not margin. The width and height of the content are calculated by subtracting padding and border widths from each side of the element. Dimension properties are set to 0 if the calculated value is less than 0.
VALUES.TITLE: border-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The width and height properties (including min and max properties) are measured, including only the content, but not the border, margin, or padding. This is the behaviour of width and height as specified by CSS2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: content-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer value that specifies the number of rowss to span.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

css\/properties\/transition-delay.SUMMARY: The 'transition-delay' property defines when the transition will start. A value of ‘0s’ means the transition will execute as soon as the property is changed. Otherwise, the value specifies an offset from the moment the property is changed, and the transition will delay execution by that offset.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Floating-point number, followed by a time units designator (ms or s). For more information about the supported time units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.

Values are rounded up to the second decimal place. Each transition-delay is paired with a corresponding object property identified in the transition-property property. If more transition-delay values are declared than corresponding object properties identified in the transition-property property, the excess transition-delay values are ignored. If fewer transition-delay values are declared than corresponding object properties identified in the transition-property property, the list of transition-delay values is repeated from the beginning until the object properties are exhausted.
VALUES.TITLE: time

css\/properties\/border-image-slice.SUMMARY: The border-image-slice CSS property divides the image specified by border-image-source in nine regions: the four corners, the four edges and the middle. It does this by specifying 4 inwards offsets.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a keyword indicating that all four values are inherited from their parent's element calculated value.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a keyword whose presence forces the use of the middle image slice to be displayed over the background image, its size and height are resized like those of the top and left image slices, respectively.
VALUES.TITLE: fill

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a <number> or a <percentage> of the offset for the left slicing line. Note that a <length> value is not allowed, and therefore invalid. The <number> represents pixels for raster images and coordinates for vector images. Also, <percentage> values are relative to the height or width of the image, whichever is adequate. Negative values are invalid and values greater than the relevant size, height or width, are clamped to 100%.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a <number> or a <percentage> of the offset for the right slicing line. Note that a <length> value is not allowed, and therefore invalid. The <number> represents pixels for raster images and coordinates for vector images. Also, <percentage> values are relative to the height or width of the image, whichever is adequate. Negative values are invalid and values greater than the relevant size, height or width, are clamped to 100%.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a <number> or a <percentage> of the offset for the bottom slicing line. Note that a <length> value is not allowed, and therefore invalid. The <number> represents pixels for raster images and coordinates for vector images. Also, <percentage> values are relative to the height or width of the image, whichever is adequate. Negative values are invalid and values greater than the relevant size, height or width, are clamped to 100%.
VALUES.TITLE: bottom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a <number> or a <percentage> of the offset for the top slicing line. Note that a <length> value is not allowed, and therefore invalid. The <number> represents pixels for raster images and coordinates for vector images. Also, <percentage> values are relative to the height or width of the image, whichever is adequate. Negative values are invalid and values greater than the relevant size, height or width, are clamped to 100%.
VALUES.TITLE: top

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a <number> or a <percentage> of the offset for the four slicing lines. Note that a <length> value is not allowed, and therefore invalid. The <number> represents pixels for raster images and coordinates for vector images. Also, <percentage> values are relative to the height or width of the image, whichever is adequate. Negative values are invalid and values greater than the relevant size, height or width, are clamped to 100%.
VALUES.TITLE: slice

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a <number> or a <percentage> of the offset for the two horizontal slicing lines, the top and the bottom ones. Note that a <length> value is not allowed, and therefore invalid. The <number> represents pixels for raster images and coordinates for vector images. Also, <percentage> values are relative to the height or width of the image, whichever is adequate. Negative values are invalid and values greater than the relevant size, height or width, are clamped to 100%.
VALUES.TITLE: horizontal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a <number> or a <percentage> of the offset for the two vertical slicing lines, the right and the left ones. Note that a <length> value is not allowed, and therefore invalid. The <number> represents pixels for raster images and coordinates for vector images. Also, <percentage> values are relative to the height or width of the image, whichever is adequate. Negative values are invalid and values greater than the relevant size, height or width, are clamped to 100%.
VALUES.TITLE: vertical

css\/properties\/flex-direction.SUMMARY: The 'flex-direction' property specifies how flex items are placed in the flex container, by setting the direction of the flex container's main axis. This determines the direction that flex items are laid out in.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode. The main-start and main-end directions are equivalent to the start and end directions, respectively, of the current writing mode.
VALUES.TITLE: row

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Same as 'row', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.
VALUES.TITLE: row-reverse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode. The main-start and main-end directions are equivalent to the before/head and after/foot directions, respectively, of the current writing mode.
VALUES.TITLE: column

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.
VALUES.TITLE: column-reverse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that all word breaking is suppressed, including at soft hyphens.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that word breaking is allowed only where word breaking opportunities are suggested. These suggestions may come in the form of soft hyphens or hard hyphens.
VALUES.TITLE: manual

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that, in addition to suggested word breaking opportunities, word breaking opportunities are allowed where determined by a hyphenation resource (dictionary). Soft hyphens take priority over other hyphenation opportunities, but are still subject to the hyphenation controlled properties.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/padding.SUMMARY:
The padding CSS property sets the required padding space on all sides of an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and its border. Negative values are not allowed. The element size is treated as fixed, and the content shrinks toward the center as padding is increased.

The padding property is a shorthand to avoid setting each side separately (padding-top, padding-right, padding-bottom, padding-left).
css\/properties\/padding.COMPUTEDVALUE: the percentage as specified or the absolute length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: With respect to the 'width' of the containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a non-negative fixed width. See length for details.
VALUES.TITLE: length

css\/properties\/column-fill.SUMMARY: Specifies how to fill columns, balanced or not.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Columns are filled sequentially such that the column heights are as balanced as possible,

depending on other column property values.
VALUES.TITLE: balance

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Default. Columns are filled sequentially such that the columns may differ in length,

depending on other column property values.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
A floating point value that indicates the relative flexibility of a child element.

A value of 0.0 indicates the element is not flexible. Any other value indicates the relative flexiblity of the child element compared to the flexibility of other child elements.

A negative value is not valid.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

css\/properties\/padding-top.SUMMARY: The padding-top CSS property of an element sets the padding space required on the top of an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and its border. Contrary to margin-top values, negative values of padding-top are invalid.
css\/properties\/padding-top.COMPUTEDVALUE: the percentage as specified or the absolute length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage with respect to the height of the containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a positive fixed distance. See length for details.
VALUES.TITLE: length

css\/properties\/column-rule-color.SUMMARY: Specifies the color of the rule between columns.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: One of the color names or RGB values in the Color Table.
VALUES.TITLE: color

css\/properties\/border-style.SUMMARY: Sets the style of an element's four borders. This property can have from one to four values.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer 8. Same as none, except in terms of conflict resolution of collapsed borders. Any element with a hidden border suppresses all shared borders at that location. Borders with a style of none have the lowest priority.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Border is not drawn, regardless of any border-width.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D groove is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: groove

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D ridge is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: ridge

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D inset is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: inset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D outset is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: outset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a dotted line.
VALUES.TITLE: dotted

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a dashed line.
VALUES.TITLE: dashed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a solid line.
VALUES.TITLE: solid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a double line drawn on top of the background of the object. The sum of the two single lines and the space between equals the border-width value. The border width must be at least 3 pixels wide to draw a double border.
VALUES.TITLE: double

css\/properties\/text-shadow.SUMMARY: The text-shadow property adds shadows to text. It accepts a comma-separated list of shadows to be applied to the text and text-decorations of the element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Required. Two <length> values that specify the shadow's distance from the text. The first is the horizontal distance, with positive values moving it to the right, and negative values moving it to the left. The secont is the vertical distance, with positive values moving the shadow down, and negative values moving it up.
VALUES.TITLE: <offset-x> <offset-y>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Optional. The blur radius is a <length> value that indicates the boundaries of the blur effect. Defaults to 0.
VALUES.TITLE: <blur-radius>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Indicates there is no shadow.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Optional. See CSS color values for possible keywords and notations. If not specified, the color used depends on the browser. The color value can be specified either before or after the offset values.
VALUES.TITLE: <color>

css\/properties\/background-origin.SUMMARY: Specifies what the background-position property should be relative to.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The position is relative to the padding box. For single boxes, "0 0" is the upper-left corner of the padding edge; "100% 100%" is the lower-right corner.
VALUES.TITLE: padding-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The position is relative to the border box.
VALUES.TITLE: border-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The position is relative to the content box.
VALUES.TITLE: content-box

css\/properties\/align-items.SUMMARY: 'align-items' sets the default alignment for all of the flex container's items, including anonymous flex items.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If the cross size property of the flex item is 'auto', its used value is the length necessary to make the cross size of the item's margin box as close to the same size as the line as possible, while still respecting the constraints imposed by 'min/max-width/height'.
VALUES.TITLE: stretch

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex item's margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line. (If the cross size of the flex line is less than that of the flex item, it will overflow equally in both directions.)
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
If the flex item's inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'.

Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment: all participating flex items on the line are aligned such that their baselines align, and the item with the largest distance between its baseline and its cross-start margin edge is placed flush against the cross-start edge of the line.
VALUES.TITLE: baseline

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.
VALUES.TITLE: flex-start

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.
VALUES.TITLE: flex-end

css\/properties\/border-top-width.SUMMARY: Sets the width of an element's top border.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default.
VALUES.TITLE: medium

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Less than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thin

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Greater than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thick

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: width

css\/properties\/break-after.SUMMARY: The CSS break-after property sets the page-breaking behavior after an element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page/column/region break is inserted (forced) after the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: always

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. A page break or column break is determined by the flow of content.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is inserted (forced) after the content block, causing the flow of content to continue in the first column of the "left" page that immediately follows the current page (according to the paging format of the document).
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page/column/region break is not allowed after the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is inserted (forced) after the content block, causing the flow of content to continue in the first column of the "right" page that immediately follows the current page (according to the paging format of the document).
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A region break is not allowed after the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid-region

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is inserted (forced) after the content block, causing the flow of content to continue in the first column of the page that immediately follows the current page (according to the paging format of the document).
VALUES.TITLE: page

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A region break is inserted (forced) after the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: region

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A column break is inserted (forced) after the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: column

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is not allowed after the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid-page

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A column break is not allowed after the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid-column

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Table and column widths are set either by the sum of the widths on the col objects or, if these are not specified, by the width of the first row of cells. If no width is specified for the table, it renders by default with width=100%.
VALUES.TITLE: fixed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Column width is set by the widest unbreakable content in the column cells.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/user-select.SUMMARY: Controls the visible highlighting of selections of text and elements. It is possible to blind out selection completely or to allow the selection of text only.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only text of the element and its descendants can be selected.
VALUES.TITLE: text

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: None of the descendants of the element can be selected, neither text nor images.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only specified elements can be selected. Only supported in Firefox and Internet Explorer.
VALUES.TITLE: element

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Everything, text and images, can be selected.
VALUES.TITLE: all

css\/properties\/-ms-content-zoom-snap-t.SUMMARY: Gets or sets a value that indicates how zooming is affected by defined snap-points. This property has no effect on non-zoomable elements. See -ms-content-zooming for details on zoomable elements.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. Indicates that zooming is unaffected by any defined snap-points. After the contact is picked up, the content will continue to move with inertia.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up is always adjusted so that it lands on a snap-point. The snap-point that is selected is the one that is closest to where the content zoom factor would normally stop.
VALUES.TITLE: mandatory

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up may be adjusted if the content would normally stop "close enough" to a snap-point. This implies that it is possible for the content zoom factor to end up between snap-points.
VALUES.TITLE: proximity

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Aligns the contents of an object supporting VALIGN to the base line.
VALUES.TITLE: baseline

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Aligns the contents of an object according to the value of the -ms-layout-flow attribute.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertically aligns the text to superscript.
VALUES.TITLE: super

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertically aligns the text to subscript.
VALUES.TITLE: sub

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertically aligns the contents of an object supporting VALIGN to the top of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: top

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertically aligns the contents of an object supporting VALIGN to the middle of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: middle

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertically aligns the contents of an object supporting VALIGN to the bottom of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: bottom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertically aligns the text of an object supporting VALIGN to the top of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: text-top

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertically aligns the text of an object supporting VALIGN to the bottom of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: text-bottom

css\/properties\/animation-direction.SUMMARY: Defines an animation's direction, including whether an animation runs in reverse in some or all cycles.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The animation plays backward each cycle. Each time the animation cycles, the animation resets to the end state and start over again.
VALUES.TITLE: reverse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The animation plays backward on the first play-through, then forward on the next, then continues to alternate. The count to determine if it is an even or an odd iteration starts at one.
VALUES.TITLE: alternate-reverse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The animation should play forward each cycle. In other words, each time the animation cycles, the animation will reset to the beginning state and start over again. This is the default animation direction setting.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The animation should reverse direction each cycle. When playing in reverse, the animation steps are performed backward. In addition, timing functions are also reversed; for example, an ease-in animation is replaced with an ease-out animation when played in reverse. The count to determine if it is an even or an odd iteration starts at one.
VALUES.TITLE: alternate

css\/properties\/transition-property.SUMMARY: The 'transition-property' property specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A list of properties, separated by commas, to which the transition effect is applied.
VALUES.TITLE: propertyname

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: All properties that support transitions have the transition effect applied when a new value for the property is specified. (Default)
VALUES.TITLE: all

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No transition effect is applied (all transition properties are ignored) when a new property value is specified.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Creates extra spacing between runs of ideographic text and numeric characters.
VALUES.TITLE: ideograph-numeric

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Creates extra spacing between runs of ideographic and non-ideographic text, such as Latin-based, Cyrillic, Greek, Arabic, or Hebrew text.
VALUES.TITLE: ideograph-alpha

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. No effect takes place—that is, no extra space is added.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Extends the width of the space character when it is adjacent to ideographs.
VALUES.TITLE: ideograph-space

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Creates extra spacing between a normal (non-wide) parenthesis and an ideograph.
VALUES.TITLE: ideograph-parenthesis

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer value that specifies the number of columns to span.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

css\/properties\/border.SUMMARY: Shorthand property that defines all the properties of an element's border in a single declaration. It can be used to set one or more values (of those: border-width, border-style, border-color).

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The border property is a shorthand property for setting the same width, color, and style for all four borders of a box.

  • Width - Any of the range of width values available to the border-width property. Default value is medium.
  • Style - Any of the range of style values available to the border-style property. Default value is none.
  • Color - Any of the range of color values available to the border-color property. Default value is the value of the element's color property - i.e. text color.
VALUES.TITLE: <border-width> <border-style> <color>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: When we set the value to inherit, the element will use border values set on its parent
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/min-width.SUMMARY: Sets the minimum width of an element. It limits the width property to be not smaller than the value specified in min-width.
css\/properties\/min-width.COMPUTEDVALUE: the percentage as specified or the absolute length or 'none'

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer followed by a % that specifies a percentage of the containing block width to use as the minimum width of the element. If the width of the containing block is not explicitly set, then the element has no minimum width and the min-width property is interpreted as 0. For more information on containing blocks and how their widths are computed, see the Cascading Style Sheets, Level 2.1 (CSS2.1) specification.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, ch, rem, or px as well as vw, vh, vmin, vmax). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

css\/properties\/flex.SUMMARY: The flex CSS property specifies ability of a flex item to alter their dimensions to fill the available space. Flex items can be stretched to use available space proportional to their flex grow factor or their flex shrink factor to prevent overflow.

css\/properties\/quotes.SUMMARY: Sets the type of quotation marks for embedded quotations.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The "open-quote" and "close-quote" values are taken from the specified list of pairs of quotation marks.
VALUES.TITLE: <string>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The "open-quote" and "close-quote" values produce no quotation marks.
VALUES.TITLE: none

css\/properties\/border-bottom.SUMMARY: Shorthand property that sets the properties of an element's bottom border.It can be used to set one or more values (of those: border-bottom-width, border-bottom-style, border-bottom-color).

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The border-bottom property is a shorthand property for setting the same width, color, and style for only one border of a box: bottom.

  • Width - Any of the range of width values available to the border-bottom-width property. It's optional. Default value is medium.
  • Style - Any of the range of style values available to the border-bottom-style property. Default value is none.
  • Color - Any of the range of color values available to the border-bottom-color property. Default value is the value of the element's color property - i.e. text color.
VALUES.TITLE: <border-width> <border-style> <color>

css\/properties\/padding-left.SUMMARY: The padding-left CSS property of an element sets the padding space required on the left side of an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and its border. Negative values are not allowed.
css\/properties\/padding-left.COMPUTEDVALUE: the percentage as specified or the absolute length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a positive fixed width. See length for details.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage with respect to the width of the containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/transition-timing-funct.SUMMARY: The 'transition-timing-function' property describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration. These effects are commonly called easing functions.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
A keyword or function that describes how the animation progresses between keyframes.

ease
Default. A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that gradually increases in speed at the start, animates at full speed, and then gradually decreases in speed at the end. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25,0.1,0.25,1).
linear
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that has a consistent speed from start to end. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0,0,1,1).
ease-in
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that gradually increases in speed at the start. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42,0,1,1).
ease-out
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that gradually decreases in speed at the end. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0,0,0.58,1).
ease-in-out
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that gradually increases in speed at the start and then gradually decreases in speed at the end. This function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42,0,0.58,1).
steps(number, position)
The change takes place in the number of equal steps specified in the first argument. The optional second argument should be either the keyword start or end. It specifies whether the change takes place at the start or end of each step. If the second argument is omitted, it defaults to end.
step-start
The change takes place at the start of the keyframe. This is equivalent to steps(1, start).
step-end
The change takes place at the end of the keyframe. This is equivalent to steps(1, end).
cubic-bezier( x1, y1, x2, y2 )
A timing function, based on a cubic-bezier curve, that takes four parameters. The four values specify the x and y-coordinates as (x1, y1, x2, y2) of the P1 and P2 points of the curve, respectively.

Note For properties other than opacity and color, the cubic-bezier curve function accepts y-coordinates outside the standard range of [0, 1]. This allows the ability to specify "elastic" effects for properties such as length and width.
VALUES.TITLE: single-transition-timing-function

css\/properties\/font-style.SUMMARY: This property allows italic or oblique faces to be selected within a font-family.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Selects a face that is classified as 'normal'.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Selects a font that is labeled as 'oblique' (sloped version of the regular face).
VALUES.TITLE: oblique

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Selects a font that is labeled as 'italic' (cursive). If no font labeled 'italic' is available, a font that is labeled as 'oblique' is selected.
VALUES.TITLE: italic
